title: IPL 2025 new schedule: Check venues, timings, date & fixtures
content: The BCCI has officially announced the updated schedule for IPL 2025. The tournament is set to resume on May 17, with the final scheduled for June 3, as per the revised plan. Following extensive consultations with government authorities, security agencies, and key stakeholders, the Board has decided to move ahead with the remainder of the season.

title: India-Pak ceasefire: Cong targets PM over Trump's 'trade deal' claim
content: After Donald Trump's claim of using trade deal threat to force India and Pakistan to a ceasefire, the Congress criticized Prime Minister Modi for his silence on the matter. Congress leaders are demanding clarification on whether India accepted US mediation and if trade concessions have been made.

title: Bill Gates' ex-wife opens up on his plan to give away wealth: 'Think it's...'
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: White House's email to fired head of Copyright Office: 'Your position as...'
content: The Trump administration's abrupt termination of Shira Perlmutter, head of the US Copyright Office, has ignited Democratic outrage, especially following the dismissal of Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden. Perlmutter's firing occurs amidst a critical review of AI and copyright, particularly regarding the use of copyrighted material for AI training.

title: 'No reference to trade': Govt refutes Trump's claims on India-Pak ceasefire
content: India has refuted Donald Trump's claim of mediating between India and Pakistan, stating that trade was not discussed during recent talks with US officials. This denial follows Trump's assertion that he used the threat of trade suspension to de-escalate military operations after Operation Sindoor.

title: What happens to the abandoned PBKS vs DC match in Dharamsala?
content: The BCCI has confirmed the resumption of IPL 2025, starting May 17 across six venues, with the final on June 3. The league was paused due to a security incident. Royal Challengers Bengaluru will face Chennai Super Kings in the opening match. The abandoned Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals match has been rescheduled to May 24 in Jaipur.

title: Mark Carney in spotlight as Canada loses 1.6m jobs, 30,000 cut in April
content: Canada's economy faces headwinds as April 2025 saw a meager 7,400 jobs added, pushing unemployment to 6.9%. U.S. tariffs on key exports like steel and automobiles are significantly impacting the manufacturing sector, leading to job losses. While the public sector offered slight relief, broader economic concerns persist, pressuring the Bank of Canada to consider interest rate cuts.

title: 'Beheno, betiyon ke sindoor hatane ka anjaam ... ': PM's strong message to Pak
content: Prime Minister Modi, following Operation Sindoor, condemned the Pahalgam terror attack, attributing it to Pakistan's support for terrorism. He lauded the armed forces' valor in eliminating nearly 100 terrorists and dedicated the operation to the women of India. He asserted that India would retaliate against terror, dismissing nuclear blackmail and emphasizing that peace talks would only address terrorism and PoK.

title: DGMO Ghai cites Virat Kohli, iconic Aussie pace duo to describe India's defence layers
content: Director General of Military Operations Lt. General Rajiv Ghai, during a press briefing, lauded Virat Kohli as his favourite cricketer after his Test retirement. Drawing parallels between cricket and national defence, Ghai highlighted India's robust air-defence system using an analogy from the 1974-75 Ashes series.

title: Troop reduction, no firing: What was discussed at India-Pak DGMO meet
content: India and Pakistan's Director Generals of Military Operations convened on Monday, agreeing to uphold the ceasefire and refrain from aggressive actions. Discussions also included potential troop reductions along borders and forward areas.

title: All airports reopened, airlines begin resuming suspended flights
content: Following the India-Pakistan ceasefire, 32 airports across north, west, and central India reopened for commercial operations on Monday at 10:30 am. Airlines have begun to reinstate their networks, aiming to restore the 350-400 daily flights that were suspended.

title: Savannah James shares adorable picture on Mother’s Day, remembers her mom
content: Savannah James celebrated Mother's Day surrounded by her loving family, sharing heartwarming moments on Instagram. The festivities included a family photo with LeBron James and their children, complete with festive decorations. Savannah also honored her own mother with a touching throwback picture, expressing her love and appreciation for her influential role in her life.

title: Updated LTCG tax rates: What investors need to know before selling equities
content: Recent income tax updates in India introduce revised capital gains tax rates on securities for residents, non-residents, and foreign institutional investors. The changes include higher taxes on equity transactions and adjusted thresholds for long-term capital gains exemptions. These revisions necessitate careful tax planning and strategic investment restructuring for various investor categories to optimize tax efficiency.

title: 'India will not tolerate any nuclear blackmail', says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in a strong statement amid heightened tensions with Pakistan, declared that India will not tolerate nuclear blackmail. Following 'Operation Sindoor,' Modi asserted that any terrorist attack would face a befitting response on India's terms. He further, lauded the Indian Armed Forces for their precision strikes during 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: 'On May 7, whole world saw our resolve turn into action': PM Modi on Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation, lauding the armed forces for their bravery in Operation Sindoor, a counterterror strike launched in response to the Pahalgam attack that killed 26 civilians. He emphasized India's resolve against terrorism and dedicated the operation's success to the nation's soldiers and citizens. The strikes targeted terror launchpads in Pakistan, with India successfully intercepting retaliatory attacks.

title: Warner's emotional tribute to Virat Kohli will leave you teary-eyed
content: David Warner paid tribute to Virat Kohli after his Test retirement announcement. Warner reminisced about their early encounters, recognizing Kohli's competitive spirit and future greatness. He acknowledged Kohli's success in filling the shoes of Indian legends and thanked him for inspiring opponents. Though Kohli remained a fierce competitor, his form in the last two years dipped, averaging just 32.56 in that period — a contrast to his peak years between 2011 and 2019, when he averaged close to 55.

title: Did China send plane-load of weapons to Pak? What its military said
content: The Chinese military has refuted reports of sending arms to Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, labeling them as rumors and threatening legal action against those spreading them. This denial follows Beijing's rejection of claims that Chinese fighter jets were used against India. Despite this, China remains Pakistan's primary arms supplier, accounting for a significant portion of its weapons imports.

title: Crossfire after ceasefire: Cong seeks answers, BJP hails Op Sindoor
content: The Congress party has questioned the success of Operation Sindoor and has asked the government whether the terrorists behind the Pahalgam attack have been killed or apprehended. The BJP, however, defended the operation and asserted its complete success. The saffron party has also announced a nationwide campaign to highlight achievements of Operation Sindoor.

title: Investors rake in Rs 16.15 lakh crore after India-Pak ceasefire
content: Indian stock markets experienced a significant surge, with Nifty50 and Sensex rising sharply due to easing India-Pakistan tensions and positive US-China trade developments. Investors saw substantial wealth gains as market sentiment improved, supported by predictions of an early monsoon. Experts suggest the rally may continue, but consolidation is possible as investors await earnings growth and key economic data releases.

title: Watch: Indian missile strikes level two key Pakistan airbases
content: India's armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, delivering a significant blow to Pakistan's military infrastructure by destroying Nur Khan Airbase, a vital hub for Pakistan's air power. The operation, a response to a terror attack in Pahalgam, involved precision strikes on key installations and terror launchpads.

title: Did India target Pakistan's nuclear site at Kirana Hills? IAF reacts
content: India has refuted claims of striking a Pakistani nuclear facility at Kirana Hills, following social media speculation linking recent earthquakes to such an attack. Adressing a briefing, Air Marshal AK Bharti sarcastically dismissed the rumors during a briefing on 'Operation Sindoor,' emphasizing that Indian forces targeted terrorists and their support networks exclusively.

title: 'Tears you never showed': Anushka's emotional farewell to Virat Kohli
content: Following Virat Kohli's Test retirement announcement, his wife Anushka Sharma shared an emotional tribute, highlighting his unwavering dedication to the game. Kohli, who debuted in 2011, concluded his 14-year Test career with 9,230 runs and 30 centuries. Kohli’s decision to retire came just days after Rohit Sharma also stepped away from Test cricket, leaving India without two of its most senior batters ahead of the upcoming tour of England. The five-Test series begins on June 20, and India will now need to appoint a new captain and rework its batting core.

title: 'When I was 13 ... ': Shubman Gill pours his heart out for Virat Kohli
content: Shubman Gill paid tribute to Virat Kohli after his Test retirement announcement, acknowledging Kohli's profound impact on him and a generation of cricketers. Kohli, who played 123 Tests, scoring 9,230 runs, retired after a dip in form, leaving behind a legacy as India's most successful Test captain with 40 wins.

title: 'A thread from your late father': Tendulkar reveals Kohli's unseen tribute
content: Sachin Tendulkar penned an emotional tribute to Virat Kohli upon his Test retirement, recalling a touching gesture from Kohli during Tendulkar's final Test. Tendulkar lauded Kohli's incredible Test career, highlighting his contribution of inspiring a new generation of passionate cricket fans and players. Kohli’s retirement comes just days after Rohit Sharma stepped down from Test cricket, removing two senior batters from selection contention ahead of India’s upcoming tour of England.

title: Pak actress removed from 'Sanam Teri Kasam' album covers; Rane reacts
content: Pakistani artists are being removed from Indian music albums and film posters amid rising India-Pakistan tensions. Mawra Hocane’s image was erased from Sanam Teri Kasam covers, while Mahira Khan was removed from Raees artwork. Producer Deepak Mukut was unaware, and Harshvardhan Rane called it “common sense.”

title: 'If Thomson don't get ya ... ': DGMO's cricket analogy for India's defence system
content: India showcased its robust air defence capabilities, effectively countering Pakistani aerial attacks with a sophisticated, multi-layered system. The Indian military displayed evidence of successful strikes on Pakistani airbases, emphasizing the precision and impact of the Indian Air Force's operations. Indigenous systems like the Akash missile played a crucial role, highlighting India's growing self-reliance in defence technology.

title: Travis surprises photoshoot crew with Taylor's pop tarts, handwritten note
content: Despite their demanding careers and time apart, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce maintain a strong bond. Swift recently showed her support by sending homemade pop tarts and a handwritten note to Kelce's photoshoot crew in New York. The gesture, featuring strawberry, raspberry, and blueberry flavors, offered a personal glimpse into their relationship.

title: Sensex spikes 3,000 points: Top 5 reasons bulls are partying today
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on India-Pakistan ceasefire and US-China trade deal progress. Both indices rallied over 3.5% cheered by domestic stability and favourable global news to register their biggest single gain in 4 years.

title: 10-year-old girl raped & killed in graveyard in UP's Saharanpur
content: In Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, a devastating incident occurred where a 10-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered by a 50-year-old neighbor. The accused abducted the girl while she was playing near her home, committing the heinous crime in a graveyard. Subsequently, he strangled her and concealed the body in nearby bushes, leading to his arrest and ongoing investigation.

title: Mumbai's Gokhale Bridge fully opens after seven years of distress
content: After seven years of disruption due to a tragic collapse and subsequent reconstruction, the Gokhale Bridge in Mumbai is fully operational, restoring vital connectivity between Andheri East and West. The reopening alleviates pressure on the waterlogged Andheri subway, offering relief to residents, especially with the approaching monsoon.

title: Jaipur's Sawai Mansingh Stadium receives bomb threat email
content: A bomb threat triggered an evacuation of Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur today. Additional SP Lalit Sharma reported that the threatening email was sent to the Sports Council's official email ID. Authorities promptly vacated the stadium, and the Bomb Disposal Squad, supported by the Dog Squad, is currently conducting a thorough investigation to ensure the safety of the premises.

title: Behind beer bust: Why your favourite pint is missing from Delhi’s shelves
content: Delhi's beer market faces a slump as popular brands vanish from government-run stores, pushing consumers to neighboring states or spirits. This decline, evidenced by a 37% drop in beer sales, is attributed to brand pushing, higher profit margins on specific imports, and policy issues. The government is analyzing sales patterns and profit margins to address the availability challenges.

title: Virat Kohli retires, legendary India batter bows out before England series
content: Virat Kohli, a celebrated Indian cricketer, has retired from Test cricket, marking the end of an era. The 36-year-old amassed 9,230 runs in 123 Tests, averaging 48.7. His final series in Australia proved challenging, and his retirement arrives amidst questions about his form. Kohli led India to their first Test series win in Australia and topped the ICC Test rankings.

title: 3 held for posting fake videos about terror attack in UP
content: Police in Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh, have filed cases against three individuals for allegedly spreading false information about a terrorist attack in the district. According to Superintendent of Police Rajesh Dwivedi, the fake videos, circulated on Instagram and Facebook, included sounds of firing and text claiming a terror attack, causing public fear.

title: Indore stadium receives 2nd bomb threat mail in 3 days; people evacuated
content: Authorities evacuated Indore's Holkar Stadium following a second bomb threat in three days. Police initiated a search after the Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association (MPCA) received an email threatening an explosion. While no suspicious objects were found, this incident follows a similar hoax email received on May 9.

title: IndiGo Cancels Flights To Amritsar, 5 Other Cities For Today
content: IndiGo has cancelled its flights to and from Jammu, Amritsar, Chandigarh, Leh, Srinagar and Rajkot for May 13.

title: "Could've Been A Bad Nuke War," Claims Trump. What PM Modi Said Shortly After
content: Donald Trump has taken credit for having "stopped a nuclear conflict - a bad one" in the brink of time. Both India and Pakistan have "lots of nuclear weapons", said the US President, adding that the two nations were going at it "hot and heavy".

title: Crushed Homes, Empty Streets: West Bank No Different From Gaza After Israeli Offensive
content: The West Bank has remained under Israeli military occupation after it was seized during the 1967 Six-Day War.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire Live Updates: Pakistan Went Around Seeking Global Help After India's Attacks, Says PM Modi
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Operations against Pakistan have only been kept in abeyance and the future will depend on their behaviour, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said.

title: "Talks On Op Sindoor, No Reference To Trade In US Talks": Sources
content: US President Donald Trump's claim that ceasefire between India and Pakistan was achieved with the promise of trade, has been denied by government sources.

title: US Military Spent Over $21 Million On Deportation Flights This Year
content: The US military has spent more than $21 million on flights to deport migrants from the United States during President Donald Trump's second term, according to figures released Monday.

title: PM Modi's Op Sindoor Speech And A Curious 'Smiling Buddha' Connection
content: "The Buddha is smiling," was the code message flashed to former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi when India successfully detonated its first nuclear bomb at the Pokhran Test Range in Rajasthan on May 18, 1974.

title: 'No Firing Or Aggressive Action': India, Pak In First Talks After Ceasefire
content: India and Pakistan have agreed that both sides will not engage in any aggressive action and no shots will be fired, said the Army after the military operations chiefs of the two countries spoke on a hotline for the first time since the ceasefire.

title: How Diplomacy Helped In Disbanding Armed Turkish Group PKK
content: The PKK's historic announcement Monday about ending its armed struggle is the result of months of shuttle diplomacy to end the decades-old Kurdish conflict that has cost tens of thousands of lives.

title: 17 Congress Leaders Join BJP Ahead Of Rahul Gandhi's Visit In Bihar
content: Just days before Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's scheduled visit to Bihar, a major political jolt has hit the party with 17 prominent leaders from Katihar district deserting the Congress and joining the BJP.

title: Transport Body Asked To Pay 37 Lakh To Boy As Accident Leaves His Hand Crippled
content: Accepting a nine-year-old boy's contention that he sustained permanent disability' after being hit by a state-run bus in 2019, a Motor Accidents Claim Tribunal in Maharashtra's Latur has directed the MSRTC and the driver to pay him a compensation.

title: Adani Group-Owned Company's SkyStriker Drones Used In Operation Sindoor
content: SkyStriker kamikaze drones, co-developed with Adani Group's Alpha Design Technologies, were employed in Operation Sindoor, codename for military strikes against Pakistan in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Class 12 Student Assaulted By School Director In Delhi, Probe On: Cops
content: A Class 12 student was allegedly assaulted by the director of a private school in the national capital, police sources said on Monday.

title: "If Pakistan Wants To Survive As A Nation...": PM Modi's Ultimatum To Islamabad
content: Operation Sindoor is not over, it has only been put on hold, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said in a clear warning to Pakistan today, as he addressed the nation about India's response to the Pakistan-linked terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Karnataka BJP Expels Local Leader For Inappropriate Behaviour Against Women
content: The Karnataka BJP on Monday expelled one of its local leaders for allegedly inappropriate behaviour towards a woman in Mangaluru district.

title: High Court Allows Termination Of 33-Week Pregnancy Of 13-Year-Old Rape Survivor
content: The Gujarat High Court on Monday allowed the termination of 33-week pregnancy of a 13-year-old rape survivor, nearly a week after a special POCSO court rejected her plea for the same.

title: Couple Says Jewellery Worth Rs 30 Lakh, Cash Stolen From Check-In Bag At Delhi Airport
content: A Bengaluru-based married couple has filed a police complaint alleging that their jewellery valued at about Rs 30 lakh and Rs 30,000 in cash was stolen from their check-in baggage at the Delhi international airport.

title: Law Tribunal Dismisses Insolvency Plea Against PepsiCo India
content: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed an insolvency petition against PepsiCo India Holdings after observing that provisions of IBC cannot be turned into a debt-recovery proceeding.

title: "No Surprise Islamabad Sounded For Ceasefire": Expert On India-Pak Truce
content: India's retaliation to Pakistani aggression following Operation Sindoor was a "clear-cut victory", said Tom Cooper, an Austrian combat aviation analyst and author.

title: How Donald Trump's Chaotic Trade War Has Evolved - A Timeline
content: US President Donald Trump's tariff decisions since he took office on January 20, from imposing sweeping duties to abruptly pausing some of them, have shocked financial markets and sent a wave of uncertainty through the global economy.

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the toi news desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape .

title: Who has the picks and players to swing a Giannis blockbuster? We're tiering all 29 teams
content: For the first time in his career, the two-time MVP is reportedly open to a trade. How ready is every team to swing a deal?

title: Giannis open to exploring best fits outside Bucks
content: For the first time in his career, Giannis Antetokounmpo is open-minded about exploring whether his best long-term fit is remaining in Milwaukee or playing elsewhere, sources told ESPN.

title: Hendrickson says Bengals no longer talking deal
content: Trey Hendrickson, who has been vocal about the lack of communication on the Cincinnati Bengals' part on a contract extension, said Monday that there have been no contract talks with the team after the draft.

title: Jordan joins NBC's NBA coverage as contributor
content: NBC announced Monday that Hall of Famer Michael Jordan will be a special contributor to its NBA coverage beginning this fall.

title: Source: Cavs unsure of Mitchell's status for G5
content: Cavaliers star Donovan Mitchell is expected to be a game-time decision for Game 5 vs. the Pacers after an MRI showed he aggravated an ankle injury, a source told ESPN.

title: Canes LB Hayes out of hospital after tragic crash
content: Miami linebacker Adarius Hayes, one of the drivers in a two-vehicle crash that left three people dead and others injured, has been released from the hospital.

title: Eagles to host Cowboys in 2025 season opener
content: The reigning Super Bowl champion Eagles will host the Cowboys on Sept. 4 in the NFL's 2025 regular-season opener.

title: Whoop! Berman staying at ESPN through 2029
content: Chris Berman will remain at ESPN through his 50th anniversary with the company, including a role in the network's Super Bowl coverage in 2027, the network announced Monday.

title: Leafs' Domi fined $5K for hit to Panthers' Barkov
content: Maple Leafs forward Max Domi was fined $5,000 -- the maximum amount allowed by the league's CBA -- for boarding Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov in Game 4.

title: 🏀 What to know about Monday's NBA draft lottery
content: Draft experts Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo break down the odds, likely picks and best fits for prospects.

title: The biggest questions after a wild first week of the second-round series
content: The biggest questions and what to watch for after an exciting start to the second round of the 2025 NBA playoffs.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Critical Game 4s for Capitals, Knights
content: Can Washington and Vegas pull even in their series? Plus, highlights and Three Stars from Sunday's games.

title: 'Understanding what it takes to win': How Jack Eichel became a complete, 200-foot player
content: Touted as an offensive-oriented center earlier in his career, Eichel has matured into an all-situations role.

title: New York's best -- and perhaps only -- chance to beat the champs? Get to clutch time
content: The Knicks have been the kings of clutch time. But will the Celtics ever let them get that close again?

title: PGA Championship tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the PGA Championship at Quail Hollow (Starts Thursday on ESPN/ESPN+).

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: Ranking non-Round 1 rookies who could star this NFL season: 10 on offense, 10 on defense
content: We picked out players chosen on Days 2-3 of the 2025 draft who could contribute right away, including Saints QB Tyler Shough.

title: Olney: The X factors defining this year's trade deadline
content: Breaking down the the themes that will shape the 2025 deadline and the teams that could be a part of it.

title: Barcelona win fourth Clásico and close on LaLiga, Chelsea lose top-four clash, more
content: Barcelona made it four wins in four games against rivals Real Madrid this season, taking a big step toward winning LaLiga in the process. Also, Chelsea's top-four hopes took a self-inflicted hit vs. Newcastle.

title: The VAR Review: Why Jackson was sent off for an elbow but Mings escaped
content: How did Aston Villa's Tyrone Mings escape a red card yet Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson was sent off?

title: Woeful Man Utd, Spurs don't deserve Champions League spot
content: The Europa League finalists slumped in league play yet again, while a legend had a final title party in Munich.

title: 'Show a little respect,' Beckham tells Minnesota
content: Inter Miami co-owner David Beckham called on Minnesota United to "show a little respect" after a series of Instagram posts following Miami's humbling 4-1 MLS defeat on Saturday.

title: Yamal: Barça don't fear Madrid like other teams
content: Lamine Yamal has told ESPN that Barcelona don't fear Real Madrid like other teams do after the Catalan club won a fourth consecutive Clásico.

title: Amorim could leave Man Utd if bad form continues
content: Ruben Amorim has accepted his job will be under threat if he cannot fix Manchester United's Premier League form.

title: Díaz keen to extend Liverpool stay amid exit talk
content: Liverpool forward Luis Díaz has expressed his desire to stay at Anfield amid continued speculation over his future.

title: Arteta slams 'unacceptable' Arsenal performance
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has described his team's performance against Liverpool as "unacceptable", despite the fact they game from 2-0 down to clinch an important point at Anfield.

title: Forest's Nuno defends owner after on-pitch clash
content: Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis stormed onto the pitch to remonstrate with coach Nuno Espirito Santo after Sunday's Premier League draw against Leicester City.

title: Mourinho sarcastically explains team selection
content: Frustrated Fenerbahce coach Jose Mourinho answered sarcastically that he "throws coins in the air" after being asked how he selects his starting XI.

title: Mbappé breaks Madrid record with Clásico hat trick
content: Kylian Mbappé broke the record for the most goals scored in a debut season at Real Madrid after scoring a hat trick in the team's high-stakes Clásico clash with Barcelona on Sunday.

title: Fight grades: Could Montreal end up as one of the top PPVs of 2025?
content: UFC 315 wasn't the biggest card of the year on paper, but the fights were entertaining minus one blemish.

title: Impact freshmen and talented transfers: These teams have the best groups of newcomers for 2025
content: Building a roster isn't just about recruiting. Combining prep talent with great transfers is key in college football and these teams did it best.

title: Betting the Eurovision Song Contest: How European sportsbooks navigate Europe's most popular betting niche
content: The annual Eurovision Song Contest is this week. Doug Greenberg takes a look at some of the most popular bets.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Minnesota routs Miami to climb the order
content: After rocking Miami 4-1, Minnesota is closing in on the Herons in the top 10 of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid keeping tabs on Romero
content: Real Madrid are already looking at more defenders ahead of Xabi Alonso's impending move as new manager. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Young cricketers, fans honour king Kohli’s legacy
content: Virat Kohli’s retirement has left a significant impact on young cricketers, who admire his fitness, technique, and leadership. Despite differing views on the timing of his exit, Kohli’s legacy continues to inspire next generation, with many recalling his memorable Test innings and moments of brilliance

title: Congress worker killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: Maoists killed his brother six months ago, says former CM Baghel and accuses BJP govt. of failing to protect tribals

title: Staff organisation objects to ‘unlawful inspection’ at KTU
content: Forum members say inspection was conducted by the Higher Education department without the knowledge of V-C to probe a complaint by an SFI leader regarding the denial of his PhD admission

title: Odisha police deploy trained commandos at Puri Jagannath Temple ahead of Rath Yatra
content: Security measures heightened for this year’s forthcoming Rath Yatra in view of tension between India and Pakistan

title: Twenty Maoists killed in recent encounter identified: Police
content: 31 Maoists were killed in the operation that was launched on April 21 and conducted along the Karegutta hills, a senior police officer said

title: West Bengal Police cracks down on anti-India social media posts; accused arrested from many places
content: Police say such online posts were few in number but whoever made the posts were apprehended and dealt as per law

title: Need collective efforts to develop Tiruvuru Assembly constituency: Vijayawada MP
content: People need not travel to the NTR district headquarters to have their issues resolved as they could approach the officials locally under the PGRS, says Sivanath

title: Committee to be formed for amendments to Cooperative Societies Act in Maharashtra, says CM Fadnavis
content: Union Minister Gadkari recommends the formulation of a new law for the cooperative sector in the State, and suggested a detailed study to examine the socio-economic impact of the cooperative movement in the State

title: False promise of marriage’ untenable after live-in relationship for years: SC
content: The court may, based on the length of such relationship and conduct of the parties, presume implied consent of the parties to be in such a relationship, the Supreme Court said

title: Modi’s address silent on Trump’s claim of U.S. averting nuclear conflict by threatening to stop trade: Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh questions if India agreed to U.S. mediation and whether it will give in to U.S. demand to open up Indian markets in autos, agriculture and other areas. Meanwhile, party leader Shashi Tharoor insists the ceasefire was a bilateral agreement, says India has allowed “a certain politician to take credit”

title: Untouchability is being practised in the country in myriad ways, says Madras High Court
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says refusing to accept donations for a temple festival from all human beings is also untouchability

title: 86,000 ‘excess deaths’ in West Bengal in 2021; four times official Covid casualties
content: The 2021 Civil Registration System report, released by the Union Home Ministry, provides data on registered births and deaths across the nation in that year

title: Chief Minister meets Governor to appraise him of situation in Telangana
content: The Chief Minister also is reported to have clarified on some of the names  suggested for Information Commission; the RTI Commissioners were appointed after the meeting

title: Australia, Bangladesh, Nepal welcome ‘understanding’ to pause firing and military action between India and Pakistan
content: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong, Bangladesh leader Muhammad Yunus and Nepal PM K.P.S. Oli appreciate leaders from both countries for decision to halt operations

title: India, Pakistan to cut troops on borders
content: This was agreed during the talks between the Directors-General of Military Operations of the two countries that were held on the established hotline.

title: Chouhan reviews kharif sowing; increase in paddy, pulses acreage
content: Ministry says stock of rice and wheat is higher than the buffer standard and the harvest of wheat in almost all major wheat-growing States has been completed and there is no impact of heatwave or high temperatures

title: Bombay High Court orders YouTubers to take down videos defaming Girish Mahajan
content: The court has restrained the two journalists from publishing or circulating similar content on their YouTube channels

title: Pakistani military used ‘doctored footage’ to mislead its own people, says PIB Fact Check Unit
content: The unit cites instances of Pakistani Director General, Inter-Services Public Relations, and the Pakistani military using Indian news clips to make false claims of destruction on the Indian side by Pakistani strikes

title: PWD to lessen width of roundabout, medians beneath Vyttila flyover to decongest junction
content: Carriageway of free-left turns at the junction will be widened, besides smoothening access to Kaniampuzha Road and Vyttila Mobility Hub, says Transport Commissioner; RTO told to relocate bus stop on the Alappuzha side of the junction

title: Maharashtra govt. holds meeting with defence forces
content: The meeting discussed improved intelligence sharing, greater use of technology, necessary precautionary measures, and the expected cooperation from the State government to defence forces

title: KMRL plans to introduce boat services in Edappally, Chilavannoor canals
content: Boat services will operate every 30 minutes along a newly navigable 11.5-km stretch from Muttar to Chitrapuzha via Edappally canal, with 10 new boats each with a vertical clearance of 3.5 metres, says the metro agency

title: Operation Sindoor a 100% success, defence forces fulfilled PM’s promise: BJP
content: The ruling party will organise an 11-day ‘Tiranga Yatra’ across the country in honour of defence forces from May 13

title: Overwhelmed by rural poll results, Assam CM sets target of 95 seats for NDA in 2026 Assembly elections
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party and its ally Asom Gana Parishad win 307 out of the 397 Zila Parishad seats across 27 districts

title: Woman passenger suffers head injury as middle berth collapses on her
content: Her husband alleges that first aid was not provided by the railway authorities for more than an hour until the train reached Salem where an ambulance was arranged

title: India engaged with China on germanium export restrictions, says embassy
content: The Indian embassy in Beijing said that representations have been received on the issue of germanium export restrictions, and the matter has been brought up with the Chinese side in written representations and meetings

title: West Bengal police are targeting Hindu youth in Murshidabad, alleges Suvendu Adhikari
content: ‘Fake FIRs’ were being filed against Hindus affected in the violence, many held in police stations under ‘fake charges’, the BJP leader said

title: Man wanted in job scam arrested while trying to flee to Sri Lanka by ferry
content: The 37-year-old, identified as Kirubakaran of Pozhichalur, is accused of cheating several job aspirants; he reportedly took money from them promising overseas placements

title: CPI(ML) People’s Liberation releases fact-finding team’s report on Vadakadu violence
content: The party has demanded demanded compensation under the SC/ST Act, legal action against perpetrators, and structural social reforms

title: Groundbreaking ceremony for flatted factory complex in Narsapuram
content: The complex which will be developed at an estimated cost of ₹13.60 crore on an 11-acre site to support MSME entrepreneurs from the constituency

title: India won’t bend to Pakistan’s nuclear blackmail: Modi
content: Operation Sindoor not over, cessation of hostilities only a pause, Prime Minister says in his address to the nation; Pakistan’s actions in the next few days will be evaluated for any further action, he adds

title: Government set to monetise its land parcels in HMDA
content: Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority notified request for proposal inviting consultants for resource mobilisation for taking up various projects

title: Eatala Rajender’s abuse of CM Revanth shows his frustration and cheapness: Mahesh Goud
content: Bhuvanagiri MP Chamala Kiran Kumar Reddy says BJP MP Eatala Rajender frustrated on not made the BJP State president

title: Ernakulam Rural police arrest one more in alleged online fraud case
content: A housewife was allegedly cheated to the tune of ₹17 lakh by promising her income through online work

title: Animal birth control monitoring committee to be formed; NGOs to be roped in to run dog shelters
content: The State government has asked the local authorities to put in place a plan and ensure adequate infrastructure and equipment in all animal birth control centres

title: Focus is on balanced growth, creating jobs, welfare for all: Revanth Reddy
content: Opening a 2 lakh sq ft facility of Sonata Software, the CM said State leads in attracting investments, maintaining L&O, reining in inflation, generating jobs and in tax collections

title: Home Minister vows to support sugarcane farmers affected by factory closures in Vizianagaram district
content: Anitha directs agriculture officials to ensure adequate supply of seeds and fertilizers to farmers and stop their sale at exorbitant rates in the open market

title: Nanthancode murders: Cadell Jeansen Raja found guilty of killing family
content: He was found guilty of murdering his parents, sister, and aunt. Judge Vishnu K. found Cadell guilty on four counts of murder under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code. The court will hear arguments regarding the quantum of sentence on Tuesday

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire understanding: Left parties slam government for allowing U.S. to broker peace
content: CPI(M) and CPI leaders cite India’s policy of ‘settling disputes bilaterally’, say govt. has provided scope to internationalise the Kashmir issue

title: Desilting of Thevara-Perandoor canal assigned to separate contractors for timely completion
content: Irrigation department takes charge of canal work for the first time; ₹10-crore project split into four segments to speed up execution

title: NIT-Tiruchi alumnus remembered for the success of Akash missile systems
content: Ramprasad Ramakrishna Panyam, a 1971-76 batch graduate of Chemical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology – Tiruchi, was the project director; he died in 2012

title: A.P. Minister directs officials to complete all canal maintenance works by May-end
content: Government has released ₹344 crore for these operations across the State, and permission has been granted to call short tenders within seven days, wherever urgently needed, says Nimmala Ramanaidu

title: Last date to apply for APEdCET-2025 without late fee is May 14, says Convenor
content: Candidates who miss the deadline can apply with a late fee of ₹1,000 until May 19, ₹2,000 until May 24, and ₹4,000 till May 26 and ₹10,000 from May 27 to June 3

title: College baseball Week 13: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers are back at No. 1 after the way they played on the road against the Arkansas Razorbacks . last week's top team the Texas Longhorns dropped a couple spots after losing its series to the Florida Gators . the Gators have managed to climb back in the top 25 at no. 23 .

title: Multiple divisions in flux after welterweight, women's flyweight title fights
content: Jack Della Maddalena stuns Belal Muhammad in the main event of the welterweight championship at UFC 315 . Valentina Shevchenko began her second career title defense and once again proved she is one of the greatest MMA fighters ever . Makhachev is the no. 1 pound-for-pound fighter in 2025 .

content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers . a similar pattern is playing out on the other side of the East bracket .
